thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Essendon players keen for Jobe Watson to captain alongside Dyson Heppell | AFL | Sporting News
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Essendon players keen for Jobe Watson to captain alongside Dyson Heppell | AFL | Sporting News

author: Kieran Francis
title: EXCLUSIVE: Essendon players keen for Jobe Watson to captain alongside Dyson Heppell | AFL | Sporting News
text:
Published on Feb. 1, 2017 
Feb. 1, 2017 
AFL personality Ricky Nixon believes Essendon should keep Jobe Watson in a co-captain's role alongside emerging star Dyson Heppell. 
MORE: Dustin Martin puts Richmond contract talks on hold 
The players are expected to hold a vote to determine the 2017 skipper in early February, with Heppell reportedly the hot favourite to be elected. 
But Nixon revealed exclusively to Sporting News that several Essendon players were keen on the idea of the star midfield duo sharing the leadership role. 
"Jobe has come back from his break and has been absolutely training the house down," Nixon said. 
"A return to quality form as a co-captain of the Essendon Football Club would be inspirational for Bombers fans. 
"I was speaking to a few Essendon players at the Big Bash recently and they were very receptive to the idea of having Watson and Heppell lead the club."
